performance-type-promotion-in-math-fn.description:
Description

Finds calls to C math library functions (from
math.h
or, in C++,
cmath
)
with implicit
float
to
double
promotions.

For example, warns on
::sin(0.f)
, because this functionâ€™s parameter is a
double. You probably meant to call
std::sin(0.f)
(in C++), or
sinf(0.f)
(in C).

float
a
;
asin
(
a
);
// becomes
float
a
;
std
::
asin
(
a
);
performance-type-promotion-in-math-fn.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
